location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 21: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, refers to his letter of 16 January 1824 (see item folio 3 2 of this volume) and encloses a translation of a firman, dated Feburary 1824, from His Royal Highness the Prince of Shiraz [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mīrzā]. The firman confirms that British subjects exporting horses to India are exempt from duty, under orders issued by His Majesty the King of Persia [Fatḥ-‘Alī Shāh Qājār].
